name: Restaurant-Style Zuppa Toscana
subtitle: Creamy sausage and potato soup. This recipe is very similar to the one served in a well known restaurant.
ingredients: 2 medium (2-1/4 to 3 dia, raw)s potatoes, cut into 1/4-inch slices
2 cups kale - washed, dried, and shredded
steps: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Place sausage links onto a sheet pan and bake for 25 minutes, or until done. Cut links in half lengthwise, then cut at an angle into 1/2-inch slices.
Place onions and bacon slices in a large saucepan and cook over medium heat until onions are almost clear. Remove bacon and crumble. Set aside.
Add garlic to the onions and cook an additional 1 minute. Add chicken soup base, water, and potatoes, simmer 15 minutes.
Add crumbled bacon, sausage, kale, and cream. Simmer 4 minutes and serve.

name: My Amazing Tomato Basil Soup (Like Applebee's®)
subtitle: This tastes just like the tomato basil soup they serve at Applebee's®. Served it with baked fries with seasoned salt and grilled gouda cheese sandwiches on thick crusty bread, panini-style.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon chopped fresh oregano, or to taste
1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil, or more to taste
6 eaches Italian-style seasoned croutons, or as needed
steps: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute garlic in hot oil until tender and fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir

Stir condensed tomato soup and marinara sauce into garlic; slowly add water. Mix oregano and black pepper into soup; bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low, and cook until flavors blend, about 15 minutes. Stir basil into soup. Ladle into bowls and top with croutons and Parmesan cheese.
